explanation.rules:
Word order:
A (T) nú B, meaning 'A is B' or 'A was B'. T = tense, marked by cí (past) or null (future).
S T V O (lé) L D, where S = subject, V = predicate, O = object, L = place, D = day.
The verb 'to see' is expressed as yɛn (O) lé.
After a consonant, lé becomes é.
Tense:
Past (V̂):
'just now' / 'be about to ...' - nɔ́.
'today' - bɛ́.
'< 3 days' - cí nɔ́.
'> 3 days' - tɔ̀ nɔ́.
Future (V):
'just now' / 'be about to ...' - nú.
'today' - nú gé.
'< 3 days' - nú bɔ́y.
'> 3 days' - nú yú.
1st person sg: n- + T/V.
nb becomes mb.
nk/ng becomes ŋk/ŋg.
nn becomes n.
Phonological rule:
After n̂, ẑ, :́, or ń, a sound change occurs, resulting in ž.
